intro: Paullinia sessiliflora, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a star in shape, hence its common name. The fruit has a sweet, aromatic pulp with a texture similar to a pear. It is often cultivated for its edible fruit and ornamental value.
